= Othello =

== Act 1 ==

=== Summary ===

* Iago tells Roderigo how much he hates Othello
* Iago and Roderigo wake Brabantio about Othello marrying his daughter Desdemona
* Iago leaves
* Brabantio follows Roderigo to go find Desdemona
* Iago and Othello outside inn, Iago telling Othello about Brabantio coming to
  look for him
* Cassio and party from Duke arrives telling him about the discussions relating
  to Cyprus
* Brabantio, Roderigo, officers arrive looking for Othello
* Brabantio attempts to attack Othello, Othello defuses situation
* All go to Duke
* Duke tells Othello they need him against the Turks
* Brabantio tells duke about how Othello stole Desdemona
* Othello professes love story for Desdemona
* Brabantio allows marriage
* Othello told he needs to go to Cyprus
* Desdemona will go with him
* Roderigo complains to Iago how he has lost Desdemona
* Iago tells him the time is ripe for breaking them up, convinces him to "Put
  money in thy purse"
* Roderigo leaves, Iago gives soliloquy about how heâ€™s doing this for money and
  fun

== Act 2 ==

=== Summary ===

*Scene 1*
* Turkish fleet ruined in the storms around Cyprus
* Cassio arrives on shore
* Followed soon by Iago and Desdemona
* Iago jokes about women's uselessness, how they are destined to be housewives
* Othello and Desdemona head off together to the citadel
* Iago tells Roderigo how much Cassio and Desdemona lust after each other
* Makes plans for Roderigo to be in charge on night duty that night, tells him
  to anger Cassio somehow


*Scene 2*
* Othello invites many people to a party to celebrate his marriage and the
  failure of the Turks


*Scene 3*
* Othello goes to sleep early with Desdemona to spend time with her
* Iago and Cassio on night watch
* Iago gets Cassio drunk
* Cassio and Roderigo go on night watch
* Roderigo angers Cassio, they both come back inside
* Montano provokes Cassio further
* Iago watches as Cassio stabs Montano (who Iago was talking to)
* Roderigo sounds a bell to alert the town and Othello
* Othello comes into the room to see Montano bleeding
* Cassio cannot speak out of shame for what he's done
* Montano says he cannot speak as it hurts too much
* Iago is left to explain what happened
	* Makes it appear as if he's restraining himself so he appears respectful
	  and honest, wanting to protect Cassio as a friend
* Othello strips Cassio of his title
* Desdemona is woken, Othello is pissed that this woke his wife
* Montano is lead off to get his wounds attended
* Desdemona and Othello go back to bed
* Cassio complains to Iago about his hurt reputation
* Iago suggests he appeals to Othello to get his job back
* Cassio refuses, says it won't work
* Iago suggests going through Desdemona, appealing to her to get his job back
	* This is so Iago can make it look like Cassio and her are having an affair
	  to Othello


== Act 3 ==

=== Summary ===

* Emilia fetches Desdemona for Cassio
* Iago draws away Othello
* Iago brings in Othello while Cassio and Desdemona are talking
* Cassio leaves, making it more suspicious
* Desdemona talks about Cassio to Othello
* Desdemona and Emilia leave
* Iago subtly plants the idea in Othello's mind that Desdemona is cheating on
  him with Cassio
	* Does it without actually stating it, only insinuating it
	* Is reluctant to share his thoughts, makes it more genuine and convincing
* Tells him Venetian women are not to be trusted, have affairs all the time
	* Plays on the fact that Othello is an outsider, doesn't know the culture
* Brings up how Desdemona's father said this would happen
* Creates dependent relationship, where Othello depends on Iago, shift in power
* Tells Othello to hold off on giving Cassio his position back
	* To pay attention to how Desdemona keeps speaking highly of Cassio and to
	  make something of this
* Desdemona arrives, Othello tells her he has a headache
	* Gives him the handkerchief, drops it out of carelessness
	* Emilia picks it up and gives it to Iago
* Othello returns following morning, complains to Iago how he hasn't slept over
  this
	* Requires Iago give him proof
* Iago makes up story about hearing Cassio talk about Desdemona in his sleep
* Tells Othello that he saw Cassio wipe his beard with Desdemona's handkerchief
* Next day, Othello asks Desdemona for the handkerchief, she doesn't have it
* Othello leaves in a rage after Desdemona brings up Cassio yet again
* Iago comforts Desdemona, says Othello is only taking out anger due to
  something bigger on her
* Bianca arrives, complains that Cassio isn't spending time with her
* Cassio gives her the handkerchief
